subject: Re: [junit] Re: JUnit--Tomcat--JDBC DataSource--JNDI

messageBody:
bofar wrote:

> --- In junit@y..., "weimar_wann" <weimar_wann@y...> wrote:
> > I'm not quite sure how to pose my question...gotten in a little
> over
> > my head here. Basically, I am writing unit tests for an application
> > that is running on Tomcat 4.xx. Database connectivity is achieved
> > through the use of a DataSource (configured in Tomcat's server.xml,
> > web.xml). The actual Java classes that I am testing do a JNDI
> lookup
> > on the DataSource to get a connection to the database. The
> connection
> > pooling works just fine while running in the Servlet Container, but
> > my problem is testing through JUnit...does anyone know how to test
> a
> > connection that needs to be run through Tomcat?
>
> Hi Weimar,
>
> I started looking at this problem myself today. Are you are picking
> up your datasource from "javax.naming.InitialContext ()" ?
>
> If so, the solution is to have different initialization sources
> for InitialContext, depending on whether the code is running in
> the Tomcat container, or in a Junit test.
>
> First you need a global flag to indicate whether testing is occuring
> or not. Let's put it in a class called Testing:
>
> public class Testing {
>
> private static boolean testing = false;
>
> public synchronized static void testingOn () {
> testing = true;
> }
>
> public static boolean isTestingOn () {
> return testing;
> }
> }
>
> Next, in the testcase that needs the database connectivity, set
> testing on in the setup method,
>
> protected void setup () {
> Testing.testingOn ();
> }
>
> Now in the code that creates InitialContext(), add the following
> lines,
>
> InitialContext ctx = new InitialContext ();
> if (isTestingOn) {
> DataSource ds = new TestingDataSource ();
> // Note that dsName should be local dnName used by
> // this program.
> ctx.addToEnvironment ("java:comp/env/jdbc/dsName", ds);
> }
>
> The last thing to do is write the TestingDataSource class that
> implements the DataSource interface. I'm planning to look at that
> this afternoon, if you are interested in a copy, let me know.
>
> Sid Stuart
>
>

Or, if you really must test within the servlet container, try Cactus:

http://jakarta.apache.org/cactus/index.html
